briefTitle: Efficacy and Safety Study for the Treatment of Dysfunctional Uterine Bleeding
officialTitle: A Multicenter, Double-Blind, Randomized, Parallel-Group, Placebo-Controlled, 7 Cycle Duration (196 Days), Phase 3 Study of Oral Estradiol Valerate/Dienogest Tablets for the Treatment of Dysfunctional Uterine Bleeding.
summary: The purpose of this study is to determine whether the study drug is safe and effective in the treatment of dysfunctional uterine bleeding.

primaryOutcome.measure: Proportion of Participants With no Dysfunctional Uterine Bleeding (DUB) Symptoms
primaryOutcome.timeFrame: Efficacy phase was defined as a 90-day period under treatment. For patients who completed up to day 6 of treatment cycle 7, the efficacy phase started on the first day of treatment cycle 4, and continued through day 6 of treatment cycle 7
